Package processingwrapper

Class Position

  • java.lang.Object
    • processingwrapper.Position
  • public class Position
extends java.lang.Object
    The Position class is used to specify the position where an object is drawn on a canvas. A Position instance is immutable; once created, any modifications will return a new instance.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  Position.DrawMode
      The Position.DrawMode class is used to specify the drawing mode of objects.

      • centeredAt

        public static Position centeredAt​(double x,
                                  double y)
        Creates a Position instance with the given coordinates.
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate of the center of the object to be drawn.
        y - The y-coordinate of the center of the object to be drawn.
        Returns:
        A Position instance.

      • topLeftCornerAt

        public static Position topLeftCornerAt​(double x,
                                       double y)
        Creates a Position instance with the given coordinates.
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate of the top left corner of the object to be drawn.
        y - The y-coordinate of the top left corner of the object to be drawn.
        Returns:
        A Position instance.

      • translateBy

        public Position translateBy​(double dx,
                            double dy)
        Translates the given Position by the given deltas.
        Parameters:
        dx - The delta in the horizontal direction to translate the object by.
        dy - The delta in the vertical direction to translate the object by.
        Returns:
        A new Position instance.
